intro: Tetracera pilophylla, commonly known as the silky tetracera, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, softly hairy leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in tropical rainforests, preferring humid and shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and are followed by woody capsules containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
